alert.note: Alert for Cooke; Dallas; Denton; Ellis; Montague (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 09 at 2:57PM CDT until August 09 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR AREAS ALONG AND WEST OF THE I-35 CORRIDOR... * AFFECTED AREA...Along and west of the I-35 corridor. * TIMING...This afternoon and evening. * WINDS...Southwest 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 22 percent. * TEMPERATURES...From 103 to 109 degrees. * IMPACTS...Rapid ignition and spread of wildfires is possible due to persistent hot and dry conditions. Lightning strikes from isolated thunderstorm activity could also spark new wildfires.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that extreme fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and dry vegetation can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Avoid all outside burning and welding today. Do not toss lit cigarette butts outside. Report wild fires to the nearest fire department or law enforcement office.
